Name: Samba Kitchen
Review Text: The appetizers, cheese bread, chicken croquettes, yucca fries were all good. But the main courses were disappointing. Steak was extremely tough. Chicken Stroganoff was tough and salty. Seemed like they fried a bit of chicken till all the …

Name: Samba Kitchen
Review Text: I love this place! Perfect find in the neighborhood for Brazilian comfort food. The take-out bowls are my clear favorite :) highly recommend!

Name: Samba Kitchen
Review Text: Really delicious moqueca, plantain and yucca fries! The server was also so friendly.

Name: Samba Kitchen
Review Text: Delicious food, and the price was quite good for NYC! Service was also very fast and kind, and the drinks were tasty and with the perfect level of alcohol (get a caipirinha). I love Brazilian food and it’s great to have this low-key spot in …

Name: Samba Kitchen
Review Text: The cheese balls are great! They are freshly made, not too cheesy and chewy in perfection! …

Name: Samba Kitchen
Review Text: My second time here. Fries, picanha and stroganoff were great. Very kind service.

Name: Samba Kitchen
Review Text: This restaurant is one of my new favorites in Midtown. Perfect for a meal before or after a Broadway show. The drinks are incredible too. Service is top notch. I cant remember our waitress's name but she and the manager checked in on us during our meal and were very attentive. I'll let my pictures do the rest of the talking.

Name: Samba Kitchen
Review Text: I think this is a great lunch spot. The dining room is cute & small. Its a open kitchen and the outdoor seating option is nice.

Name: Samba Kitchen
Review Text: Great place with good vibes! I went with a large group (8 of us) for Sunday brunch and they were easily able to seat us all. Lots of space! …

Name: Samba Kitchen
Review Text: Came here after seeing a show on Broadway. The food was pretty good. We had the sirloin steak sandwich, rice and black beans, mussels with rice and the coconut and cheese crepes. …

Name: Samba Kitchen
Review Text: Pretty disappointed. I wanted to grab something quick and easy, so I got the pasteis de queijo and the arugula salad. The pasteis were chewy instead of having a crisp exterior, but were otherwise okay. The salad made me kind of angry—for …

Name: Samba Kitchen
Review Text: We have ordered delivery from here many times. Food is delicious and VERY well packed! The Brazilian coxinha, the empanadas, the beef strogonoff, fried bananas, yucca fies are all so good. Definitely recommend if you are looking for a simple yet very good Brazilian food.

Name: Samba Kitchen
Review Text: We made reservations for 7:30 on a Wednesday night, and I'd highly recommend reserving a table here. The place was moderately busy and there were a few smaller tables that were open. …

Name: Samba Kitchen
Review Text: Medium sized place with decent space between tables. Went here on thanksgiving for dinner with a friend who doesn’t eat seafood. Sadly though their online menu showed lots of chicken options, the in restaurant menu had just one chicken …

Name: Samba Kitchen
Review Text:
Casual brazilian food and no wait at all if you go early.  We took the meet pie to start and the house specialties for the main dish.  Nice place to eat, music not loud to you can talk and friendly staff.
Note: brazilian cheese breads available!

Name: Samba Kitchen
Review Text: Very tiny Brazilian restaurant with a Rio de Janeiro vibe. The waitress is amazing and the food is pretty close to what you eat in Rio de Janeiro. The best dishes are Feijoada, Picanha e Strogonoff. They do a very good caipirinha. You should try the passion fruit. Hummm Delicioso mmm

Name: Samba Kitchen
Review Text: Came for lunch. A few complimentary cheese bread bites were a cute surprise. Got the beef, rice, and beans lunch special and the steak, fried egg, fried potato slices lunch special. Pretty good Brazilian. …

Name: Samba Kitchen
Review Text: Actually I really like this place. The service was excellent. The food was very good. It's warm inviting and has a lot of charm. I'd recommend checking this place out if you're in the area it's worth a visit.

Name: Samba Kitchen
Review Text: We ordered jumbo shrimp and chicken curtlet for kids and three meat dishes. All were authentic and worth trying. Reasonable portion.l and price too.

Name: Samba Kitchen
Review Text: This was my first time here and it went be the last. All the food from the appetizers to the dessert was absolutely fantastic. The drinks were very good too. I suggest that you try the authentic drinks they have on the guest page of the …

Name: Samba Kitchen
Review Text:
This place was a wonderful experience for my family and I.

This is my first time to try Brazilian food. So  not sure if this is an …

Name: Samba Kitchen
Review Text: Their Brazilian cheese bread was amazing and their presentations are beautiful. Unfortunately the rest of the food sucks.  I should have known when the place was completely empty. The waiter brought the wrong salad (shocking since as I …

Name: Samba Kitchen
Review Text: Wow what an amazing experience!! I always order from this place online but today was the first time I ate there in the restaurant (The online orders are great, packaged perfectly and instructions are always followed). It is a small and cozy …

Name: Samba Kitchen
Review Text:
First, the foods were amazing ( Well seasoned, not too salty not too bland). The sauce of the steak was just amazing.
It was first time to experience with Brazilian food …

Name: Samba Kitchen
Review Text: Best Brazilian food I've had! My father grew up in Brazil and could not stop talking about this restaurant for the rest of his visit to NYC - he said it took him back to his time in São Paulo. …

Name: Samba Kitchen
Review Text: Great, I like the food, the environment, employees are very friendly and they know their products. When it come to drinks, a little bit more alcohol will be perfect but knowing that they are in Manhattan ... is normal to maximize the profit. Definitely a place to come back.

Name: Samba Kitchen
Review Text: This place is amazing! We stumbled upon Samba after deciding we didn't want to order in. The food was delicious, the wait staff really friendly, and the atmosphere was great. When we ordered, we asked to substitute the rice for yucca fries, …

Name: Samba Kitchen
Review Text: A relatively casual, but also intimate Brazilian restaurant - very pleased with the experience! Simple food, but large portion sizes. Lighting is a bit dim, and can get loud - tables are quite close to each other. …

Name: Samba Kitchen
Review Text: I chose this awesome place for my mom’s birthday. We invited 10 total guests of family & friends. Bertha & her husband were so very accommodating! We all had such an amazing time. They have a live Samba music trio for Sunday brunch. They …

Name: Samba Kitchen
Review Text: First time having authentic Brazilian food and wow, this place blew me away with flavor. It was happy hour so I got Passion Fruit Caipirinha which I highly recommend. For my dish, I decided to be bold and order Frango Tropical, which was …

Name: Samba Kitchen
Review Text: Will come back again. Ordered the tropical chicken w/ poached pear, banana and pineapple. Delicious combination. Drink is a guava Caipirinha and the money is worth the drink. Would recommend as a different expirience. Suitable for small friendly gatherings w/friends, dates etc.

Name: Samba Kitchen
Review Text:
I came to samba kitchen for brunch on a Saturday.
They had live music and the food was excellent as always (available on uber eats as well) …

Name: Samba Kitchen
Review Text: This was my wife and I first visit at the Samba and we couldn't be more impressed. It had been a long time since I had a good caipirinha. The food was excellent too. We started with some excellent Brazilian meatballs to share, as a …

Name: Samba Kitchen
Review Text: Great and friendly service! I got the chef recommendation shrimp with coconut milk dish, that comes with mash and rice also. Beautiful dish that came and it was really good too! Had a great time here!

Name: Samba Kitchen
Review Text: My nephew David & his wife Stacy took us (me & my husband)  here for lunch on our 'whistle-stop' visit to NYC. The food was AMAZING  & the Ciapirnha(s) delicious....it's good to have relatives that know THE BEST places to eat!!

Name: Samba Kitchen
Review Text: Great place, with great food, drinks and live music! We went for brunch on a Sunday and was super good! I highly recommend it. Try the passion fruit caipirinha!

Name: Samba Kitchen
Review Text: My wife and I decided to make a quick trip up to NYC. As we're Brasilian, we always try to connect with the Little Brazil community when we're in NYC. This time, I google'd Brazilian restaurants since I didn't want to go to the same ones we …

Name: Samba Kitchen
Review Text: Yum yum yum i love the Pão de queijo, Chicken Croquettes and the steak. That’s all i eat when i come here.

Name: Samba Kitchen
Review Text: Service was great! I’m Brazilian and I miss Brazilian food a lot. I had Picanha, linguiça, yucca fries, beans and rice. Picanha was great, yucca fries were really good, I wish the rice had more garlic and onions. …

Name: Samba Kitchen
Review Text: Food presentation 10! Food taste 10! Service 10! Drinks 10! Everything from the small bites to the main dish was amazingly delicious!!!

Name: Samba Kitchen
Review Text: They might have sized down their restaurant and menus due to COVID but kept the great vibe, their best menus and drinks! The outdoor seating area was pretty comfortable and the service was great. The food came a little slowly but I think …

Name: Samba Kitchen
Review Text: Ate here with two others while I am in NYC from Chicago. We started with salgadinhos (fried balls of goodness); and while my friends drank water, I had a caipirinha, YUM!! The shrimp dish (moqueca) was delicious with plenty of shrimp, and …

Name: Samba Kitchen
Review Text: This is the cutest most adorable Little Brazilian kitchen. The ladies are so sweet and friendly. The food is so good and rightly priced. They renovated the spot so it looks like this modern cheerful oasis on the block. You can have the best …

Name: Samba Kitchen
Review Text: I was surprised with a small birthday party here and as a Brazilian I can confirm the food is pretty authentic, tasty, and the staff is really great. i enjoyed their stroganoff and the caipirinhas were pretty delicious.

Name: Samba Kitchen
Review Text: Fantastic place with a good vibe, stopped in here on Sunday for a few cocktails and live music. Cocktails were really good, had a few different flavors of the caipirinhas, lime and guava were my favorite.

Name: Samba Kitchen
Review Text: Good food. Few options but all very good. Service was excellent

Name: Samba Kitchen
Review Text: The restaurant is small, cozy and clean. The staff is amazing the girls are friendly and offered great customer service. I order picanha 🥩 and it was yummy, the rice and beans as well. Mini empanadas great choice for appetizers, first time …

Name: Samba Kitchen
Review Text: Delicious food, big portions, friendly staff, cozy location

Name: Samba Kitchen
Review Text: Order from here at least twice a month. The food is generally good but confused because sometimes it comes out really weird. We ordered Beans and rice about two weeks ago and I don’t know how but the beans tasted exactly like a cigarette? I …

Name: Samba Kitchen
Review Text: Excellent food, friendly staff. Must go if you like Brazilian food and drinks!

Name: Samba Kitchen
Review Text: Samba has moved to a smaller location, but the food and the service is a good as always. Happy to know they are keeping the good work. Our server was super friendly and we enjoyed the quiet street on a Friday night with some good caipirinhas!

Name: Samba Kitchen
Review Text: Love the food and service. Very attentive and the food was delicious and they were generous portions.

Name: Samba Kitchen
Review Text: Large portions and great flavors, plus the caipirinhas are all really good!

Name: Samba Kitchen
Review Text: Visiting from it of state, my family is Brazilian, food was in point and drinks were great!

Name: Samba Kitchen
Review Text: Amazing, traditional, home-made Brasilian food! I'm from Brasil myself so I was very excited to find this gem of a restaurant! Try the Coxinhas (chicken crocket appetizers), and if you're in the mood for a cocktail, the Passion Fruit …

Name: Samba Kitchen
Review Text: The food is good, vibe is good, everything is good, making this place ideal to hang out at Friday night

Name: Samba Kitchen
Review Text: Not only did this place have amazing food, but also the service was incredible. This place is so cute and it has a fun atmosphere that makes you want to come back again and again.

Name: Samba Kitchen
Review Text: Yummy and interesting combination of ingredients. Good chunky pieces of meat in their stew.

Name: Samba Kitchen
Review Text: Would probably only recommend going there in person which is a better experience. Ordering delivery was meant to take 30-40 minutes but instead took about 2 hours. In my opinion good service should extend to those who order delivery, not …

Name: Samba Kitchen
Review Text: I go to this special restaurant every couple of days  as I love the ambiance that is unique to this place. The team is exceptionally loyal and experienced. The service is awfully rapid. Needless to say, the food you get is great. I ate …

Name: Samba Kitchen
Review Text: I come to this special place often because I love the good mood that is outline this restaurant. The staff is very loving and well trained. The service is extremely quick. Needless to say, the food you eat is great. I ate there more than once and I was always happy. The expense is honest. I highly recommend this place to to everybody.

Name: Samba Kitchen
Review Text: Our waitress was really terrific and made some nice suggestions.  Very attentive to our dinner. Great conversation.  My wife and I shared a pot of feijoada, a bean stew. It was amazing, especially with a touch of the hot sauce Josie recommended. I will go back to this place regularly!

Name: Samba Kitchen
Review Text: Visited Samba for brunch on a Saturday– solid choice. Variety in food options on brunch/dinner menus! The cocktails were so good. I got a bloody but tasted 2 caipirinhas and they were incredible! Service was friendly and the restaurant was well decorated. Great experience.

Name: Samba Kitchen
Review Text: I work for the restaurant business so I expect a really really great service. This place is really good! The music, the food, the drinks have a great quality. Guava drinks are my favorite! Server was very friendly and helpful but he …

Name: Samba Kitchen
Review Text: Always pleasant staff serving delicious Brazilian dishes in a casual atmosphere.

Name: Samba Kitchen
Review Text: Really delicious Brazilian food. Appetizers were made perfectly including sausage, kale salad, shrimp. Recommend their margarita-- not as sweet as typical one so a nice change! Husband loved the rice and beans which also had pork stew and …

Name: Samba Kitchen
Review Text: This is a cute Brazilian restaurant.  They start with cheese bread that is gluten free.  It was good but not spectacular.  I had the Frango Tropical.  The chicken was pounded thin and cooked perfectly.  The sauteed fruits were not fresh and …

Name: Samba Kitchen
Review Text: I had some steak there and it was fantastic. I was there during happy hour and had a nice drink. The service was nice. We reserved for 8 or 9 of us and had no problem. Wine selection was great as well.

Name: Samba Kitchen
Review Text: Definitely the original pan do queso!! All the food is great and the caipirinhas are lit!! We had a good time! 100% recommended

Name: Samba Kitchen
Review Text: The best food and drinks!!!  Not for children ... It was the best place I've ever experienced. Coconut camoron was the best. Coconut caiprinha OMG to die for.

Name: Samba Kitchen
Review Text: The waitress was so sweet and did her job perfectly! The food was to die for! We had the yucca fries, clams with garlic in white wine, the shrimps and the house salad... top notch!! Definitely coming back

Name: Samba Kitchen
Review Text: I can't recommend Samba enough!! The drinks are all delicious - we got a huge variety and they were all so good. And the sangria is homemade which is always a plus! We were already charmed by the incredibly friendly and sweet owners, but …

Name: Samba Kitchen
Review Text:
This restaurant is one of my new favorites in Midtown.
Perfect for a meal before or after a Broadway show.
The drinks are incredible too. Service is top notch.

Name: Samba Kitchen
Review Text: Nice spot to get a drink and some bites. They have about eight beers on tap, they make drinks, obviously they have caipirinhas. Staff was great, was seated and served right away. I was satisfied with this. They play Brazilian music, not too loud, which was perfect.

Name: Samba Kitchen
Review Text: Ate dinner here a couple weeks ago — we agreed to sit in the front of the restaurant to get seated sooner but it was a bit warm. We started with some Mandioca Frita and Caipirinhas (passion fruit and guava). For my entree, I had two choices …

Name: Samba Kitchen
Review Text: Incredible food. Fresh, homemade and full of flavor.

Name: Samba Kitchen
Review Text: I already gave Samba Kitchen a 5-star review when they just opened and I am back to give them another 5 stars because this is our favorite place and we can't get enough of it! Everything about Samba Kitchen is MAGNIFICENT! Fantastic food, …

Name: Samba Kitchen
Review Text: Great gluten free options.  Looking for a place for lunch before a 2:00 show and luckily found Samba with an online search.  Let us order off the dinner menu at lunchtime because of the GF options. Would absolutely return.

Name: Samba Kitchen
Review Text: Pretty unique Brazilian restaurant located in Midtown. I enjoyed the cocktails that's I ordered as well as the cheese bread appetizers. There is live music sometimes and the staff are great. Would recommend to anyone to give this place a shot!

Name: Samba Kitchen
Review Text: Superb environment and very affable service. The menu was crisp and enchanting. Will surely recommend this place to friends and family. Affordable prices and big meals. Great work.

Name: Samba Kitchen
Review Text: I would never return to this place or recommend it. Bad services, they rather keep you waiting instead of telling you the exact waiting time.

Name: Samba Kitchen
Review Text: I made reservation but wasn’t busy so we decided to just eat at the bar. Our bartender was very friendly which always help. I wanted to order everything (as usual) but settled for what I was craving (Moqueca and Camarao no Coco) since they …

Name: Samba Kitchen
Review Text: Great service with amazing food! Perfect price on the food! Will definitely visit when back in NY. The flavors keep you eating more. Great local beer on the menu and the bartender can mix up some good drinks.

Name: Samba Kitchen
Review Text: I had medium steak platter. It was delicious. Juicy and flavorful. The staff is very friendly and welcoming. That's very important to me.

Name: Samba Kitchen
Review Text: Hands down the best Brazilian restaurant in the NYC. I've traveled to Brazil many times the food is so authentic and juicy. I will be back soon for more. The picanha just melts in your mouth, what else can you ask for.

Name: Samba Kitchen
Review Text: Great happy hour and tasty sharing plates! The staff is super friendly.

Name: Samba Kitchen
Review Text: They bring cheese bread rolls before the meal and that is stellar. I had a strawberry caipirinha and then the shrimp and coconut dish which I loved though moat people would find the shrimp slightly overcooked. My husband had the pork chop which was also slightly overcooked but "all right."

Name: Samba Kitchen
Review Text: This is the best Brazilian restaurant and one of the only places I can get mosquecalike I had in Salvador Bahía! The staff are so friendly! True Brazilian vibes!

Name: Samba Kitchen
Review Text: We really enjoyed our pre-theater meal at Samba Kitchen.  The restaurant was pretty quiet because of a late season snow storm and we were not in a hurry, and our server, Tomas, made sure that while our meal was leisurely, we were not …

Name: Samba Kitchen
Review Text: Went for one of their specialties (top sirloin/picanha). Got really disappointed with the quality of the meat, particularly considering the price point and the fact it is a Brazilian restaurant. …

Name: Samba Kitchen
Review Text: Great menu, very accessible for all tastes including those with no Brazilian food experience. This is not the greasy spoon local offering I had hoped for, but a solid choice for this wanting authentic cuisine at a reasonable price (for midtown).

Name: Samba Kitchen
Review Text: Great food, great staff, great drinks...just great!  The caipirinhas are the best I've had and the food is simply the best Brazilian food around.  The service is super friendly, attentive and helpful (for those times when you just can't …

Name: Samba Kitchen
Review Text: We went late one weekend and didn't have to wait for a table. The food was delicious. We all tried different items and all were cooked and seasoned well. …

Name: Samba Kitchen
Review Text: I get to eat here a lot since I work right next to it. I have to say their customer service is always fantastic and they keep the place well kept consistently. Pricing is affordable and they serve big portions.

Name: Samba Kitchen
Review Text:
The first time the food was good I order for pickup
The second went with my family for outdoor dining and the experience was horrible the food was bland and I asked for the check more than2 times to pay made me …

Name: Samba Kitchen
Review Text:
Different location, but still equally good.
I have great memories of this place and I wish them all the best. Great food for good prices.

Name: Samba Kitchen
Review Text: Stopped by for a quick drink before a show. Happy hour prices were terrific. The bartender was so pleasant, we had great service. Sangria was delicious.

Name: Samba Kitchen
Review Text: I get to eat here a lot since I work in the area. I have to say the service is always great and they keep the place clean consistently. Rates are fair and they serve sizeable portions.

Name: Samba Kitchen
Review Text:
Very kind people and very good food. The size of the portions where nice and well enough.
Also the servants where really kind and helpful. It is WAY better than anything I've seen closer to the times square.

Name: Samba Kitchen
Review Text: Best Brazilian food in NYC by a mile! Service here is top notch and the food is beyond authentic. Feel like I'm in Brazil! Shout out to Leo, the best server there is. …

Name: Samba Kitchen
Review Text: Best Caipirinha's I had in a long time, I tried the lime and passion fruit one and they were amazing. I was sad because I had dinner before going there, but the food looked and smelled amazing.  The ambient is very cozy and very chic. I will defenitely come back.

Name: Samba Kitchen
Review Text: Best food I've had in a while, v.great selection of meats and fish with very good vegetarian options (heart of palm highly recommended) Prices are very reasonable. Reserve ahead if you have a bigger group b/c seating is slightly limited.

Name: Samba Kitchen
Review Text: Went here for dinner because of good reviews and they did not disappoint. Went in a group of five and everybody was very happy with what they got and the bread we had with our dinner was amazing. They were very friendly and had good service. Prizes are good too. Highly recommended.

Name: Samba Kitchen
Review Text: I had an amazing time at Sam a, me and my family ate feijoada and picanha. The chef came to bring the food, the caipirinha was very good. Nice place to eat, good music and staffs

Name: Samba Kitchen
Review Text: Was recommended by my daughters Brazilian makeup artist.   A bit pricey but the servings are HUGE!   Try the hot sauce at your own risk!   All the servers are straight out of fashion magazines and such delightful accents. Drinks are …

Name: Samba Kitchen
Review Text: It was good.  Not my favorite.  A tad on the pricier side for quality of food

Name: Samba Kitchen
Review Text:
I have never eaten yucca flour before, however the yucca fries are delicious.
The food here is tasty and the staff are very friendly. …

Name: Samba Kitchen
Review Text:
It's not a Churrascaria so it is definitely the BEST Brazilian Restaurant I've been to in NYC!
A professional caipirinha specialist. The foods is so fresh and good. …

Name: Samba Kitchen
Review Text: Great restuarant with a great vibe and wonderful caipirinha! We sat at the bar, enjoyed the drinks and the music. The food was close to real Brazilian food, staff very worm and welcoming.

Name: Samba Kitchen
Review Text: This restaurant has dramatically downsized and looks nothing like the photos. It's a take out spot mostly now. People nice enough, but total bait and switch.

Name: Samba Kitchen
Review Text: For a Brazilian place, the food was too plain and dry, I was expecting more. Also, for some reason you will find  20% tip by default in the check which is questionable. Have to admit, the interiors was nice and cousy, that was the main reason we came here.

Name: Samba Kitchen
Review Text: Excellent Brazilian food and often with entertainment.  The folks here are terrific and friendly and the steak and other dishes are delicious.

Name: Samba Kitchen
Review Text: Food and service were very good!  We went on New Years Eve and had a great time with the staff and enjoying the delicious fare prepared for us.  Everything was fresh and delicious.  Cocktails were good too!

Name: Samba Kitchen
Review Text: By far one of my favorite places in NYC. The food is delicious and plentiful, the drinks are perfect - especially if you love Caipirinhas. Seriously the best Brazilian a la carte restaurant in NYC.

Name: Samba Kitchen
Review Text:
What can i say? Is the best Brazilian place in nyc.
Food is delicious,  staff is friendly,  drinks addre original,  they have vegetarian options, (what I never found in others Brazilian places i have been in …

Name: Samba Kitchen
Review Text: This place is realistically brazilian. Employees are so wonderful, energetic, meet customers demand and execute task professionally. I hope everyone can try thier traditional dishes + am so in love with thier fine brazilian beverage call Guarana Antartica. I wish they would have distribute it across the country.

Name: Samba Kitchen
Review Text: Great spot doing Brazilian food right. We ordered a steak dish that was simply prepared and served with pico de gallo, yucca flour, fried sliced potatoes, rice and beans. Hot sauce is available upon request, which appeared to be an oil …

Name: Samba Kitchen
Review Text: Fantastic and flavorful food, I liked the character this place has, and the employees were very welcoming. I will definitely visit here when I’m around.

Name: Samba Kitchen
Review Text: After a while looking for a Brazilian place out of the 46th district, just found this cozy place in Hell's Kitchen. Food is simple but excellent cooked, warming music and friendly service. Prices don't break your budget. The view over 9th Avenue is refreshing...

Name: Samba Kitchen
Review Text: I introduce this place to my friend and we both were very happy. I love the food and the feijoada the most. We will be back!!

Name: Samba Kitchen
Review Text: This place is amazing, they have a really wide selection of authentic Brazilian dishes. Staff is friendly and accommodating, will definitely have to go back and try more.

Name: Samba Kitchen
Review Text: Great food, amazing crowd and attentive staff. This place is catering to Brazilian tastes, so be ready to ask a lot of questions about the menus if you are not familiar with the cuisine.

Name: Samba Kitchen
Review Text: Every staff there was very nice to me!! The food is great! I really missed eating a typical Brazilian lunch! Gostinho de casa!! :)

Name: Samba Kitchen
Review Text: The team is really friendly and welcoming, the food is authentic and delicious!

Name: Samba Kitchen
Review Text: Get the steak!  I got the black bean stew, which was disappointing if I'm honest.   The table next to me got an amazing looking and smelling steak on a sizzling platter.  Service was great, good experience overall

Name: Samba Kitchen
Review Text: A rare local Theater District/Hell’s Kitchen restaurant that is comfortable and takes reservations without charging $30+ for entrees. I’ve added Damba Kitchen to my short list of midtown restaurants that don’t suck.

Name: Samba Kitchen
Review Text: I love this place!! Great service. This is one of my go to restaurants in the whole City. Highly recommend the pork chops and any/all caipirinhas.

Name: Samba Kitchen
Review Text: Great brunch. Service was excellent. Live music and good, interesting food choices. Also very reasonable prices, especially for the area.

Name: Samba Kitchen
Review Text: Nice atmosphere, and nice servers, but really overpriced. The seafood dish was flavorful but gave me food poisoning, and the vegetarian dish was really bland. It was just wasn’t worth the price.

Name: Samba Kitchen
Review Text: Soooooo good! I was craving brazilian food and they did not disappoint! Great drinks also! Definitely make a reservation. The service was amazing.

Name: Samba Kitchen
Review Text: Forget our order and after one hour wainting we asked whats the problem. They played like they are just busy and promissed to bring meal in two minutes. It arrived... But on the other table which came after us half an hour at least:) Run away in the end without paying even for drinks...

Name: Samba Kitchen
Review Text: Amazecheeseballs.......amazing food, loved the Brazillian cheese balls/bread, our server was lovel and friendly, the staff couldn't do enough for us.  Highly recommend, if I'm ever back in NYC I will be going out of my way to return.

Name: Samba Kitchen
Review Text: I’m obsessed with coxinha and pastel de queijo but these are very popular and made fresh so they can sell out fast! The stroganoff is delicious and very different from any other stroganoff I've had - in the best way possible. They have lovely caipirinha. Highly suggested!

Name: Samba Kitchen
Review Text: I prefer this restaurant a lot. theres a very special ambiance. The kitcen is great. the service is efficient and the personel is courteous. The pay is modest. profoundly recommend.

Name: Samba Kitchen
Review Text: I've known the owner, Eduardo, for close to 10 years and first met him when he waited at Ipanema on 46th Street.   He made manager several years later and made Ipanema what it was back then: the best Brazilian spot on that strip. …

Name: Samba Kitchen
Review Text: Organized a friend's bday party here - staff were really nice and accommodating. Food was good, drinks were great, and atmosphere was chill. Definitely recommend.

Name: Samba Kitchen
Review Text: I only went there to buy some Coxinhas to go and the guy at the reception said "ohh alright, wait a second." He was gone for almost 15 min and didn't even offer a place to sit or wait. When he came back there were some people waiting to be …

Name: Samba Kitchen
Review Text: Great food and drinks, great ambiance and service!

Name: Samba Kitchen
Review Text: Great place service was great, our server was authentic and very grateful for our company, the live music was great thank you to MR. Reed he introduced me to this beautiful location. I will be back here again. Vlad freyygo

Name: Samba Kitchen
Review Text: Awesome and fresh food, I loved the vibes this place has, and the workers were very nice. I will surely visit here when I’m around.

Name: Samba Kitchen
Review Text: Service was really very warm and friendly. The Brazilian cocktails were super tasty. Definitely recommend. Brand new bar.

Name: Samba Kitchen
Review Text: Great Maracuha's. Music with brunch on Sunday is the best to send you home full and happy. Look forward to the next visit

Name: Samba Kitchen
Review Text: This place simply knows how to treat their clients. Consistently with a friendly approach. The food is affordably priced, always tasty and clean.

Name: Samba Kitchen
Review Text: I always been a huge fan. Food and ambiente great. But sometimes I rather to choose another restaurant cus prices are higher than others restaurants in the area and also really goo ones!!

Name: Samba Kitchen
Review Text: Delicious and authentic Brazilian food!

Name: Samba Kitchen
Review Text: Were there yesterday night! Awesome and very attentive service, really good food and very enjoyable live music. We felt very comfortable and well taken care off- thank you!

Name: Samba Kitchen

Name: Samba Kitchen
Review Text: I just love their food. I always get awesome customer service there. The place is well organised and the workers are always nice. I highly recommend this place.

Name: Samba Kitchen
Review Text: Garlic sauce with rice was great. But the flan was a nice surprise! More dense than regular flan

Name: Samba Kitchen
Review Text: Great and delicious food, I loved the character this spot has, and the cashiers were nice. I will surely visit here next time.

Name: Samba Kitchen
Review Text: One of my go-to spots to grab some food. fantastic location, well kept, and fantastic customer service. I highly recommend them!

Name: Samba Kitchen
Review Text: This spot is worth giving a shot. They have big portions for reasonable rates. Always well kept and with excellent ambience. Will visit here again.

Name: Samba Kitchen
Review Text: Food was good, but the size of the restaurant was average for their location (west of the theater area).  They do have a bar, which was nice.

Name: Samba Kitchen
Review Text: I went there yesterday for lunch and I had an amazing experience. The food was delicious and of high quality, the place was clean and organized, the staff was really nice and prices are very reasonable. I'll definitely go there again, no doubt!

Name: Samba Kitchen
Review Text: Excellent food and service. Beautiful ambiance but a little on the small side. All in all it was a great experience for our party of 6.

Name: Samba Kitchen
Review Text: Everything here was delicious. From the cocktails,  of which we had plenty, to the tapas style starters and entrees. Simply yummy!

Name: Samba Kitchen
Review Text: Authentic Brazilian food, great staff and they are open late. Very good option after a long day visiting the city.

Name: Samba Kitchen

Name: Samba Kitchen
Review Text: The caipirinha was great. The vatapa  was not vatapa. It was more like a shrimp stroganoff.  Ir didn’t taste bad but it is not vatapa.
